meanings.definition: A member of the mystical knightly order in the Star Wars films, trained to guard peace and justice in the universe.
meanings.sent1: The jedis fought bravely against the dark side.
meanings.sent2: In the Star Wars universe, jedis are known for their lightsabers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the jedis bring a droid to the party? To use the Force on the dance floor!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like that of a jedi, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The jedis' connection to the Force made them formidable warriors.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'jedi', referring to a practitioner of the Force in the Star Wars universe.
meanings.sent1: Many jedis gathered to discuss their training.
meanings.sent2: Luke Skywalker trained new jedis to uphold peace.
meanings.sent3: Why did the jedis go to the market? To buy lightsaber batteries!
meanings.sent4: Their unity was as powerful as a group of jedis in battle.
meanings.sent5: The jedis' bond with the Force was their greatest strength.
